item.description:
Crime Writers is a unique crime game that - besides providing the exciting atmosphere of solving a murder - also challenges the writing skills of the players.
The original black and white photos evoke the mood of classical crime fiction as well as the visuality of suspense and film noir movies. 
The crime element cards are really inspirational without exercising too much influence on the storytelling process.
It is a card-based cooperative creative party game with semi-competitive elements.
It contains 86 cards that represent the five basic elements of a crime story in four stacks of cards: crime scene, killer/victim, motive, cause of death. 
The game has two stages. The first is the writing stage, where everyone writes a story of a crime using the elements from the cards they have drawn.
In the second stage, the player who's turn it is becomes the writer and the others become guests.
The guests try to reveal the crime story by asking and guessing and try to figure out the whole story, observing the rules of asking.
The guests must continue until they can make all the connections and tell the whole story.
The game only comes to an end once the story of every player has been found out.

An exciting card game for any party of teenagers and adults.

Playing Time: 15-20 min./player

—description from the publisher

item.description:
BACKSTORY

The notorious flagship - Dead Reckoning - has been scuttled in open water by the Royal Navy. A small crew of cut-throat seadogs has washed ashore on the beaches of an uncharted island...

OBJECT OF THE GAME

The winner is the player that survives the longest.

SURVIVING

To survive, players compete to collect resources and craft them into items to better protect themselves from the threats of the island.

BEWARE OF BITES!

As players collect resources and craft items they’re regularly bitten by spiders. PURPLE, GREY, BLACK and BROWN cubes symbolize venomous spider bites.

When a player receives “bites” she places them on her player board. During play, too many bites incapacitates players. In the final phase, too many bites kills them.

—description from the designer

The world is coming to an end, and every aspect of your survival depends on your strategic thinking, cunning, negotiating skills and your sense of humor!

Start as a leader, someone with the skills and courage to confront a post-apocalyptic world and all its new challenges head on. To attract others to your cause you’ll need to give them a reason to do it. As one of dozens of unique leaders, you’ll need to amass unique assets such as The Hydroponic Farm, The Gunsmith’s Shop, and The Abandoned Surgeon’s Office and others. Every asset has unique abilities which will enable you to attract other survivors to your cause.

Survivors will rally to your cause once they have someone who can lead them and provide food and shelter. They’ll fight and die for you and others in the camp. However, they aren’t simple pawns in a game of survival, each one of these people have unique skills and abilities which can change outcomes of battles and effects of disasters. You’ll team up with dozens of unique survivors, such as The Young Patriots, Kim the Farmer and or Jose The Welder or several others. Each survivor has unique sets of skills you can combine in order to help you prosper and stay alive.

Once you have assets and people, you’ll need to equip them properly. Barter with other players or use the Trade Post and equip your followers with everything from a Shank and Molotov Cocktails to Drones and Gatling Guns or one of dozens of other unique pieces of gear. Each equipment has special abilities and effects that can turn the tides of war with a roll of the dice.

Once you have something worth taking, others will come for it. Those who believe in taking other than earning their keep will be even more brutal and hungry after the collapse of society. You’ll need to defend your survivor compound against attackers of all kinds, everyone from Biker Gangs and Hungry Mobs to Your Crazy Neighbor and an Angry Drunken Dwarf and a lot more.

The local government will notice your growing power and they will exercise their right to take control of everything you’ve built. They’ll send everything from The Marines and The National Guard to The Diplomat and The Property Tax Collector. Will you let them take what they want, fight them off or try to join them?

In the midst of it all, keep your guard up against other Leaders who will try to expand their influence by taking you out of the game. Use whatever destiny sends your way in the form of Chance Cards such as The Voodoo Doll, Lightning Bolt and a Runaway Goat to try stay on top and win the game.

Nature, accidents and the unexpected will also try to wipe you out. Pandemics, Heart Attacks, Ebola, Earthquakes and Nuclear Attacks are just a few of the catastrophes only the prepared will survive.

—description from the publisher

In Tribe, you are on a mission to help as many tribes as possible to thrive and prosper. Players places ornaments on human figures organized in a circle, which will decorate the human figures each in their own unique way and eventually form "tribes" that bear common features.

Will the pride of tribes be maintained throughout the ages? And what will be the form of humanity beyond history? The future of the tribes is in your hands.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
"This game simulates on a board the continuous territorial wars that devastated Europe during the Middle Ages, seasoned with a little magic. In the game you must wisely manage your resources (gold, wood, iron) so that you can form armies and equip them in the armouries and stables that you will have to build.

If you do it well, you will conquer new territories with new resources. Castles, Wizards, Archers and Knights are also part of the game; use them with a good strategy and remember that there can only be one King, so...."

—description from the publisher

Each player controls a capital and starts the game with 2 infantry units, 1 archer, 1 garrison counter and 1 armoury.

The game lasts a maximum of 24 turns.

In his turn, each player can do the following actions in any order he wants:


 Collect production from all their territories
 Acquire constructions
 Purchase units
 Move your units around the board


Combat is resolved using custom six-sided dice.

To win you have to conquer a number of capitals or territories depending on the number of players. If all 24 turns are exhausted and no player has won, then the winner will be the player with the most territories and capitals.

"Xian" e.g https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xian_(Taoism) , or the "godly spirit," is the final form that a human can become through the act of training and enlightenment. A Xian is practically immortal, and possesses godly powers.

During the early Qin Dynasty, many Taoists are obsessed with the idea of Xian, and study the act of Xian intensely, looking for all possible ways to increase their chance of enlightenment. Many fascinating legends are the results of such obsessions. During the game, players will travel back to the ancient kingdom, and attempt to attain enlightenment by controlling spiritual stones and "Qi," the life energy.

By studying under Taoism, players will race to see who can rise among their peers, and be the first one to become a Xian and achieve immortality.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits

item.description:
Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits is a 3 to 6 player game where you play politicians using creative bribery, or inventive blackmail to manipulate ordinary peeps of Breggsit Island and gain their support. Draw cards from the deck to construct the perfect most hilarious bribe or the most devious cunning and poignant blackmail to suit your target and ward off any counter bribes from the competition.

This adorable hilarious Board Game satirizes the ridiculous nature of modern politics and campaigning. Enjoy rich original artwork, easy to learn, enjoyable game play and hilarious in game mechanics.

—description from the publisher

UFM: Football Highlights is the first game of the series of board games about the football (soccer) club management.

It's about the best moments of football matches.

You are the manager of one of the two underdog (mediocre) clubs which eager to be real glory hunters.

In the game, you have to determine the formation of footballers on the field, give instructions to players, strengthen the team by newcomers, learn and use new formations. There are referees, red cards, injuries, penalties, substitutions and everything is like in real football.

You have to rise from mediocre team to the winner of the first UFM trophy - Underdogs Cup.

Game components are divided into 5 envelopes. In each of those is the card of the referee appointed for the upcoming match, new or additional components, as well as brief rules on how to use them. The scenario and rules will become more complicated with the growth of your experience. In the final you have to fight for the Underdogs Cup.

In first envelope you get team with 15 players and the most popular formation 4-4-2. Each player has attack and defend skills. There are also cards "match events" and referee card. Every referee has own preferences. First one is loyal. There are in the game different referees: strict, very strict, unfair, undecided, etc.

You don't need to play full match. Instead of it you have to play 3 attacks, named "highlights", in every time of match. "Highlight" is finished when goal scored or team lost the ball. All footballers lay face down in starting formation and attacking manager choose one of them and open his card. Defending manager choose one of his players and open his card in front of attacking player. Then they roll dices (d10) and add result to attack and defend accordingly to their players. After each "highlight" you have to open "match event" card. And make all actions from it. Every effect of "match events" depends on the referee of the match.

In the next envelopes you get "team instructions" cards which helps to affect actions at the field and to decrease random.

After completing the scenario with Underdogs Cup, you will get more freedom to act. You can open the last envelope with additional formations, referees, and game currency. For this money you can buy your own players. There will be also stickers to improve skills of your players and tournament cards for playing your own tournaments.

Underdog - the weakest of two or more rivals. Literally meaning is "lower dog". The term arose by the end of the XIX century in the US during the dog fights. Often losing dog usually lies next to the paws of the winner or literally under it. The more surprising thing was its unexpected victory over a strong opponent.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The Senior Moments Game
Just as you think you have more in common with stale bread (you need replacing and you’re only good for toasting), along comes Befuddled, Bemused & Bewildered, the game that will tell you if there’s life in the old dog yet, or confirm what others have been telling you for years: you’re well past your sell-by date.

Packed with quirky questions that will blow the cobwebs from between your ears, heaving with hilarious challenges to get you on your feet (let’s face it, you need the exercise…), take a gentle amble around the game board with every card you draw…

—description from the publisher

name.value: Who do you think you are?

item.description:
Prove your detective skills in this brain-teasing board game based on the BBC's hit show Who Do You Think You Are? Clues about celebrities’ family trees are hidden around the world. The first player to piece them together and uncover all of the ancestral secrets is crowned winner!

After hearing about the mysteries a celebrity wants to solve, move your aeroplane along the global flight paths. Every time you land, check the ancestry book for relevant clues. It’s your goal to combine information from several sources and use your powers of deduction to get the correct answers. With the roll of the dice you can even hide hints from the other players and get double clues to help you zoom ahead.

Whilst the celebrities are fictional, the history is accurate. Marvel at stories that are by turns funny, gruesome and exciting! Go back in time as you discover how our shared history has shaped the world.

—description from the publisher

OX is a two-player, portable, table top game which combines strategy and luck. It's fast and addictive.
 The aim of OX is to get all of your counters across the board before your opponent, this is done by moving counters according to the roll of the dice. Depending on your roll, you can move one or two counters and attack your opponent, defend yourself or simply get your counters across the board. It becomes a battle in which you try and both advance your counters forward and push your opponents back.

The game is made of leather and wood and rolls up to make it portable. The game involves the leather board itself with a wooden centre piece, 16 counters and a pair of dice.

—description from the designer

Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by "Miniaturas y Wargames" to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)

In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.

Join new playable Gearloc characters Stanza and Duster as they journey down the Sibron River in search of answers in this standalone expansion/sequel to Too Many Bones!

Too Many Bones: Undertow allows for 1-2 players out of the box, but by bringing in additional Gearlocs from the original game or adding in characters like Ghillie, Nugget, and Tink, you can create an adventure for up to four players. Undertow features all new baddies, encounters, tyrants, and a double-sided battle mat. Battles take place both on land and on your raft, adding even more variety and brain-bending tactics.

item.description:
Reanimator is a cooperative mystery-story board game for 1-4 players.

Players will work together taking on the role of the narrator from Lovecraft’s original story in order to perfect the protagonist’s experimental reanimation serum.

Classic characters including Herbert West, the City Watch, and the Undead wander through Arkham to help or hinder the players as they undertake their profane task.

Subplot decks of cards will develop your story through gameplay, forcing players to respond to new adventures and challenges only the world of the ReAnimator can provide!

Players play through six iconic serials akin to the original novel series with modified enhancements from the comics.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Hoksaa! is a quick pattern recognition game. Game board is a circle built on puzzle pieces with easy and harder side. The game play consists of rolling a special die that will tell players what to search this round. Some examples: blue things, loud things, square things. Sandtimer is flipped, and players try to find as many of matching things during that time and mark them with their pieces.

—user summary

Place nine letter cards on the game board, turn a category card and set the timer in motion. You have to come up with words using one of the letters, but the longer you take, the more time the next player will have.

Once a player cannot come up with a word, they lose one point. Everyone starts with three points and continue until there is a winner.

—user summary
Children's dexterity game. Either place or throw a ring around the battery-operated snake's head. Difficulty can be adjusted by adding or removing pieces to the snake.

Based on the animation of the same name, Icebreaker Snow is a cooperative board game, where players try to pilot all ships to harbor before the deck runs out.

To pilot a ship home, one ice breaker has to be on same location with the ship, and another on the destination harbor.

Race your opponent against the clock to see who is the fastest at stacking their cups! Colour co-ordinated, this fast-paced game is all about reaction times and hand eye co-ordination. Will you be the first to stop the clock with your cups colour co-ordinated? Great fun for all the family!

Fish or Frog, what’s hiding under the Lily Pads? It’s a classic game of matching with a clever twist that will keep parents and children guessing. Flip a Lily Pad Card to see which fish you need to catch. Use a Fishing Rod to hook the fish you think will match. Reel it in to reveal its telescoping colored tail. If it’s a match, you keep the catch! Pay close attention! If you flip over Grumpy Frog’s Lily Pad, you throw a fish back. Can you remember which one’s which? Catch the most fish to win!


 Place all the Little Fish in the center of the table so the heads face up, and the telescoping tails are tucked inside.
 Shuffle the Little Fish so no one knows which one’s which and put the Fishing Rods to the side.
 Shuffle the Lily Pad cards and lay them face down around the Little Fish.
 The youngest player goes first! Start by turning over a Lily Pad Card of your choice. If the Lily Pad shows a…
 Fish – Take a Fishing Rod, choose any one of the Little Fish on the table and hook it with the Fishing Rod. Lift the Little Fish so that everyone can see which colored body falls out from underneath the head. 
 If it matches the fish shown on the Lily Pad Card, place it down on the table in front of you, making sure to collapse the body back inside its head. 
 If there is no match, then the Little Fish you chose remains in its current position.
 
 Rainbow Fish – Choose ANY one of the Little Fish and drag it in front of you. Do NOT lift it up and reveal the color of the body. If there are no Little Fish in the middle of the table, then you may take one Little Fish sitting in front of another player, careful to not reveal the body of the Little Fish.
 Grumpy Frog – Bad Luck! Push one of your Little Fish from in front of you back in the middle of the table. Do NOT lift it up and reveal the colored body inside. If you don’t have a Little Fish in front of you then nothing happens and your turn is over.
 
 If you turn over a Lily Pad card that reveals a Little Fish that you think is already in front of you, then you can use a Fishing Rod to lift it up and show the match. If you’re correct, you may turn over another Lily Pad Card and have another turn. If you do not reveal the matching Little Fish, your turn is over.
 The game ends when all the Lily Pad Cards have been discarded. The player with the most fish in front of them wins! If it’s a tie, players will check the tail tips of their Little Fish – the player with the highest number on their Little Fish wins the game!

The game is played as two teams, both trying to escape from troll mountain. First players have to collect enough cards to repair the route, and then move through the route to safety. But beware, the troll might catch you. Then you will have to start your escape from the beginning again. The first team to get all their figures to safety is the winner.

—user summary

The conquest of space was one of the greatest achievements of the 20th century.
In 1957, the first satellite - named Sputnik 1- was launched into orbit. Just four years later, Yuri Gagarin was the first human in space, aboard the spaceship Vostok 1.

This game is dedicated to the early space explorers: all the outstanding people who worked to make space travel possible. As Yuri Gagarin said at the moment of his launch: “Let's go!”

You are the head of a Research & Development Hub in a Space Research Center, competing with other such Hubs in the spirit of the Golden Age of Astronautics. Your goal is to complete large- scale space projects by gathering the best and brightest minds humanity has to offer.

Thanks to your efforts, satellites, manned spaceships, and orbital stations will be launched into space!

You score Progress points by recruiting Specialists and completing Projects. The game ends when all available Projects are completed, or you have recruited 12 Specialists to your Hub. The player who made the most Progress is the winner!

Key game features:

 Closed loop resource system: when recruiting a Specialist to your team, you pass Research tokens to a player to your left.
 Specialists are assigned to the Divisions according to their skills. The more Specialists you have in a Division, the easier it is to recruit new ones to that Division.
 All Specialists have unique abilities. Only the ability of the top card in each stack is active. Therefore, by adding a new Specialist, you often get a new ability but loose the other one. Think carefully what is more important for you at that moment in the game!

item.description:
Kumite is a miniature game that recreates KO fights between elite fighters from all over the world, who practice various martial arts and want to rise to victory to become the best fighter in the world.

The first thing you must do is to create your fighter, choosing its nationality, corpulence and style of martial arts; this will change its attributes and provide you with favorable and unfavorable actions. Then create your deck of cards with 40 of the techniques your fighter will use to attack or defend from the 108 available. After this, to the tatami!

The game works with a system of successes in rolls of dice, throwing as many as it’s indicated in the value of the attribute to use, being successes 4, 5 and 6. The fighters move in a squared board using their techniques every round , having an active turn and a passive turn where both fighters can attack and defend themselves.

The game will be won by the player who manages to reduce the opponent's Stamina attribute to 0, or after 15 rounds of play, the one that has subtracted more Stamina to his opponent.

—description from the designer

Scribble Time is a speed drawing and guessing game. Can you scribble what you hear in a second? Can you remember what your drawing is meant to represent?? "Sure!" you might think! Well, we'll see about that! Ready your pen, on your marks! GO!

In more detail, the active player reads out twenty words within twenty seconds, and all other players have to scribble these words to help them remember as many as possible. Afterwards a player gets 2 points for guessing correctly what they have drawn, if they are wrong, the other players may attempt to correctly guess and snatch 1 point for themselves.

This game also has advanced mode/ Insane Mode/ Semi-Co-Op Mode/ Super Insane Mode.

item.description:
In this Hungarian, but language independent, game you are a space smuggler. You have to use your energy to travel solar systems, and trade with other ship. 
If you want to be the best, you have to be clever, and make your action fast. 
Try to sell all of your cargo, and win the game.

In the game you get two dice. You don't have to throw, just put to a selected solar system, with a selected number of the dice. That's the betting, and you get the solar system(s). You have to do it in same time with the other players, and if you are ready, take a selected energy coin. You have to be fast, because everyone do it in same time, and if the last energy coin has been taken, the turn is finished. For the energy, you will get cargo (in four colour), and in the selected solar system(s), there are coloured ships, they will buy your cargos with the same colour. You will repeat this double turns a couple of times, and at the and of the game, you have to collect as many solar system as you can, and sell as many cargo as you can. You will get positive points for the solar systems and negative for the remained cargo.

—user summary

MoMo & Friend is a speedy and funny party game that challenges your cognitive skill. Are you ready to activate your brain?

Are you ready to activate your brain for listen the comment, visual process the cards, reasoning skill to make a right decision in a second?

The dealer plays a card and gives a command: either “UP”, “DOWN” or “STAY”, then all other players will play a card with the correct “Button” number, which matches to the “Floor” number and command just given.

Be careful, it’s easy to make mistakes!
Let’s train our brains together!

This game includes and advanced mode.

Oodles of Utils is a tabletop boardgame that has been developed to encourage players to have fun while discussing 'tribal priorities' chosen blindly at the start of the game. These tribes each prioritises two of the four points (Money, Health, fun and Goodwill) and are then rewarded at the end of the game for having 'lived' according to their 'tribes' priorities.

The game is competitive and cooperative, which creates a warm atmosphere and brings out the best in players.

The game is a two sided board, where players throw the dice and move around the board along the path. When players throw doubles they may move forward or backwards. There are 3 levels of play, from 13+ (younger with assistance). The game takes approximately 2 hrs, depending on how much discussions people have. The game player numbers are three to six. Five players are optimal.

The goal of the game is to earn priority points by making decisions based on your tribal priorities. Lower value points may be traded with other players, thus creating an opportunity to cooperation with other players for a win/win outcome.

—description from the designer

name.value: This One Time, I...: The Game of Ludicrous Life Choices – Party Edition

item.description:
Have you ever hooked up with someone within an hour of meeting them, or blacked out before 9 p.m. because you were too drunk?
 Unlike most of the party games you have played, THIS ONE TIME, I... provides an explicit, hilarious opportunity for friends to relive their funny, dirty and downright crazy life experiences. We have probed deep into the dirty pasts of people to compile hundreds of ludicrous life choices that we can all relate to.
 The game is played with Confession Cards, which are examples of ludicrous life choices, and Rule Cards which tell you how to play each round - that make it easy and fun to learn who’s the craziest, dirtiest, wildest friend of the group!

Every round, a player selects a Red Rule Card from the top of the pile, reads the instructions aloud and must then do as the Rule Card says.
 If you are guilty of an act detailed by a Blue Confession Card given to you, you must add it to your losing pile (face up) in front of you until the end of the game, so that everyone can enjoy reliving your bad decisions. If you are not guilty of a Confession Card, you must scrap it.
 The first player to have 10 Confession Cards in their losing pile loses the game. There are no winners in this game, only losers.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to Trifouilly-les-Oies. The fields will be replaced with a commercial zone. Your mission: save the archaeological sites from destruction. Will you be able to resist to the weather and unforeseen events? Will you finish the research in time?

Operation Archéo offers you two game modes : a "Family" mode or an "Expert" mode, and three levels of difficulty. It is played solo and up to 6 players, from 9 years. The parts last 30 or 90 minutes depending on the desired duration. The optional web application can be used free of charge.

In Operation Archéo, teamwork is at the heart of the game. Each of the six archaeologists has unique abilities. Who will you choose to incarnate? Séverine the team leader and her motivation techniques? Franck the backpacker and his paternalistic advice? Raphael the resourceful? Mélanie the hard to cook? Youssef the perfectionist? Anaïs the ingenous?

Search the ruins left by the men of prehistoric mens, the Gallic, the Roman and the French of the Middle Ages.
Castles, aqueducts, houses, temples, cemeteries, churches and many more are only waiting for you to be discovered in scenarios inspired by real archaeological excavations.

—description from the publisher

Legacy of the Stars is a space empire-building game in which you take control of one of eight factions racing to rebuild human civilization after a devastating galactic civil war. Your goal is to be the faction whose legacy will shape humanity's future by collecting Legacy Cards representing your accomplishments. 
 The core mechanic involves playing action cards from your hand to gather the game's three resource types, spend those resources on ships, outposts, cities, and technology, and move your ships to engage in combat or conquest.

There are six different kinds of Legacy Card: Expansion (having outposts on lots of planets), Empire (having lots of cities), Enlightenment (researching high-level technology), Extermination (destroying cities and outposts during conquest), Exploration (devoting resources to the renovation of derelict warp gates), and the Exalted (destroying "Exalted Guardians", which are the ancient autonomous war machines that still protect a few special planets).

The first player to collect 8 Legacy Cards is the winner. Players track their progress on the Legacy Track, which triggers events whenever the first player reaches each new legacy total.

—description from the designer

name.value: BAM! Ihr habt es so gewollt!

item.description:
In this party game, you fill the gaps on cards with matching terms. You do not need to make a grammatically correct or even meaningful sentence; all you need to do is convince the BAM! Master that your concept is the most original and funny.

BAM! Ihr habt es so gewollt! (which translates as BAM! You wanted it so!) contains the popular "cards of the month" and in addition some of the best suggestions from the community.

item.description:
It is the distant future. The world has become a dangerous place where the balance of power rests between opposing forces known as Factions. These groups manipulate and influence the citizens of the Community in an effort to join their side and vanquish the opposition.

Each Faction uses movement and control to turn the tide against their opposition. By expanding influence over the Community, power can be acquired. Choose a side and become the Master of Wills.

Master of Wills can be played one-versus-one or two-versus-two. It’s all about moving the cards—you want to move as many points to your side of the board as possible while your opponent is trying to do the same for their side. Community cards are each assigned a value, and each card is represented by a character from one of the eight sectors of the Community. Moving those cards can trigger the basic movement of other cards on the board.

The cards move from a neutral area in the middle of the board toward your side or the opponent’s side through three rows. Each row represents how close the character is to joining your Faction. The rows are called Recruits, Loyalists, and Allies. Each row represents how loyal the character is to your side. If they reach your Allies, those points are locked in.

When the game begins, each player will choose a Faction and build a deck of Faction cards that caters to their own style. These Faction cards allow for even more powerful card movement. For instance, let’s say you choose a Faction card that says, “Choose any card from your opponent’s Recruits or Loyalists and move to your Allies.” Then imagine your opponent has a card with a 15-point value in their Loyalists row. You can snatch up that valuable card and lock it into the Allies row on your side of the board, giving you a large number of points and taking those same points away from the opponent. A single, well-timed Faction card can be a serious game changer.

—description from the publisher

item.description: Replicants! is a Scifi themed resource gathering game for most ages. Each round you deal out a new resource grid, then players take turns placing their drones on the grid to collect the corresponding resources and then use them to level up their Replicants in order to gain victory points, abilities and of course, more Replicants. It is a relatively fast paced game that is half turn based and half simultaneous play that accommodates 2-6 player and takes 45minutes to an hour to play.

To play Telma, everyone chooses a nickname. The cards are dealt and, one by one, everyone begins to reveal one card on the table at a time. When two equal cards appear on the table, players who played the same cards have to call out each other's nickname as fast as they can!

Whoever says first wins, and the other takes the cards! Whoever gets rid of all the cards first is on the way to a glorious victory!

item.description: The fast & crazy game of triangle cards! Green means go, but watch out for the reset cards or you lose a turn! To win, you've got to be the first to get rid of your cards by being strategic and getting others to reset before they can place a card. Triangle cards emphasize where you can play your cards. Sometimes in your favor and others not. The corners of the triangles point to the areas of the playmat you can use. Includes 105 triangle cards of multiple colors and printed playing mat.

name.value: Alphabet Island: A Letters and Sounds Game

item.description:
This is an educational game for children learning to match lowercase and uppercase letters or learning letter sounds. There are two levels of play, level one using the matching letters and level two using the sounds.

The theme is alphabet island and the game includes a hungry shark, ready to eat all the letters.

To play you take turns flipping over a card and revealing a capital letter. Then all players race to find the disc with the correspondent lower case letter, or picture/word stating with the sound of that letter. The first person to find it gets to keep that disc and the person with the most discs at the end wins.

To enhance the game play there are starfish, crabs and the shark. If you find a disc that uncovers a starfish you must give one of your discs to another player. If you find a crab you get to take one from someone else, and if you flip over a shark card you must feed a disk to the hungry shark. (There are four shark cards in the deck.) The shark is a 3D plastic toy with a lever on the back that allows the shark to actually eat the disks.

The instructions come in English, French, Spanish and German and you could play level one in any of those languages, but to play level 2 you have to play in English.

item.description:
10 May 1940: a handful of German troops landed atop Belgium's strongest fort using gliders (painted light blue underneath to match the sky) and took it out. This two player game simulates this key event in the fall of France. Each turn is 10 minutes and each ground unit is about 10 men.

This is a postcard game that was released from LPS POCKET BATTLE game No. 18

Za is a fully-collaborative crossword building game. Players pull objective cards from the Za deck, plus a selection of letter tiles, and work together to build a crossword that satisfies the objectives. Whenever they do, they draw more letter tiles and objectives.

—description from the publisher

Pinocchio Mini: True Or False is a storytelling game that helps you to get to know your friends and family better. You might discover a lot of funny things about them you didn’t know about!

600 different topics to stimulate the storyteller to tell infinite life stories.

The active player chooses 1 topic to share his/her relevant experience (true story) or to make up a story (lie story), then place the corresponding True/Lie card face down on the table. After telling the story, other players can pay 1 Angel token to ask a question to check the authenticity, then guess the story is true or lie. Who guesses wrong will stack up a nose token on his/her Pinocchio head. To increase to excitement if half or more players have guessed correctly, the storyteller has to stack a nose token also.

Game continues until all players finish to tell a story, the shortest nose Pinocchio will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The Swedish forest is full of beautiful plants, exciting animals and strange fungi. But for them to live and thrive, you need to create the right habitat. In the ambitious family game Skogen ("The Forest"), developed over many years by experienced biologist Daniel Thorell, it's your job to fill the forest with life by alternating species and element tiles on the board. The game is an eye opener for the diversity of species and environments that surround us (and we promise: a much more fun than the dusty encyclopedia found in your grandparents attic). Place old trees, meadows and other elements to makes your woods flourish - the player creates the best forest wins. Or to put it in other words, you reap what you sow!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Unicorn Glitterluck: A Party for Rosalie
Einhorn Glitzerglück: Eine Party für Rosalie

item.description:
Yippee! A new baby unicorn named Rosalie is coming to Cloudland!

The unicorns Glitterluck, Stardust, Marvel Flower, and Magic Swirl want to give Rosalie a fantastic reception and throw a huge welcoming party. They invite all their friends and collect incredibly large cloud crystals. But they must hurry since everything at the party is supposed to be ready before Rosalie arrives.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The 19th century empires of Russia and Britian engaged in a series of strategic conflicts in Central Asia known as The Great Game. Relive that history in only 18 cards.

Based loosely on the COIN system, the Great Micro Game features a solitaire variant known as K1M (Kiplings 1-Player Mode). Despite the name, this allows you to play as either the British or Russian Empires.

Originally an Entry for the 2015 18-Card Microgame Contest and the Mint Tin Contest, it won 1st place for Top 3 Designs by Guest Judge Chris Hansen.

There are two editions of the game in the files section:
Core Edition - This is the original entry that won the Mint Tin Contest Guest Judge Award. This is the more play-tested game and will likely be a better solo play experience
Alternate Edition - This edition has a video explanation, some thematic tweaks, and a different rule set. I recommend this edition if you want to learn by video.
